snippet: A funeral was held Friday morning for the relatives who died after the S.U.V. they were in fell from a Bronx River Parkway overpass.
abstract: Hundreds gather at Church of St Raymond in the Bronx for the funeral of family members who died after vehicle driven by Maria Nunez Gonzalez plunged over a guardrail on the Bronx River Parkway; all seven passengers were killed, including Gonzalez's parents and her ten-year-old daughter. Photos (M)o

byline.original: By WINNIE HU and CHRISTOPHER REEVE

lead_paragraph: On Friday morning, the day before Jazlyn Gonzalez was supposed to receive her first holy communion, she arrived at the Church of St. Raymond in the Bronx for the last time, in a shiny white coffin. It came in a procession of seven hearses that rolled up under bleak gray skies, announced by the tolling of a church bell. The hearses had to double- and triple-park on the street outside as, one by one, the coffins bearing 10-year-old Jazlyn in her white communion dress, her mother, aunt, two young cousins, grandmother and grandfather were carried up the church steps. It was a funeral Mass to bless a family dealt an incomprehensible loss.

headline.main: Hundreds Mourn 7 Family Members Who Died in a Bronx Car Crash
